content: boyd pixie bonnet pattern by steph jamison @yarn republic please do not alter rewrite share or sell any portion of this pattern in any way please do not use my photos without consent you may sell items created using this pattern but out of respect for the time and effort i have put into this design please credit my shop when doing so i love seeing and sharing your projects tag me on instagram facebook & etsy pattern @yarnrepublic #yrboyd i suggest reading carefully over the pattern before beginning if you still have questions feel free to email me - yarnrepublic@gmail com follow care instructions on your yarn of choice because of the choking hazard of the ties babies should not be left unattended while wearing if you decide to sell these bonnets i suggest making customers aware of this risk boyd pixie bonnet pattern - yarn republic 1 pattern is written in us terms difficulty level easy materials - 60 75 82 94 107 124 138 grams 45 55 62 69 80 92 102 yards big twist natural blend yarn or similar super bulky weight 6 yarn to make gauge ears/yarn pom pom not included - 9 mm m/13 crochet hook - 4 stitch markers optional for placing ears - tapestry needle - scissors key measurements - chain chain newborn 13 -14 - single_crochet single_crochet 0-3 months 14 -15 - half_double_crochet half_double_crochet 3-6 months 15 -16 - decrease single_crochet 2 together 6-12 months 16 -18 - st s stitch es 1-2 years 18 -19 5 - slip_stitch slip_stitch 3-5 years 19 5 -20 5 6-8 years 20 5 -21 5 gauge 8 half_double_crochet x 7 row = 4 x 4 you should aim to be within 25 of this - you may be tempted to skip this as i often am but i strongly recommend completing the gauge swatch for this pattern to get the most accurate sizing for your yarn of choice you may need to adjust your gauge or the hook size larger hook if your swatch was too small smaller hook if your swatch was too big it can be difficult but try not to stretch the yarn when measuring - if you re unsure of how to complete a gauge swatch this video may be helpful - if your gauge swatch meets the stitch count but is tall or short on row you might find this video helpful for this project if you have to choose between stitch count or row height accuracy i think it s more important to meet the row height though i suggest meeting both when possible sizing notes i recommend measuring the child s head when possible as their age may not line up with the age bracket these bonnets are designed to fit near the hairline if you would like a looser fit more hood- like or tighter fit snug/cupping the head you might consider sizing up or down accordingly as you are working you will probably feel like
